Review: It was a pleasant stay there. Good staff with nice service. But rooms are not that calm because I was able to hear the noise coming from outside. And I had to wait even after my check-in time Which is not appreciable.

The entry of the hotel is not very attractive. few items mentioned in the breakfast Menu were available. The food items ordered are very expensive and service very delayed. Only Overall very expensive for the facilities and service

Room is spacious and clean. Located at busy road, traffic noise continuously hear inside room. No restaurant and room service. No parking. Not value for money.

Just opposite a good restaurant is there

It was a Wonderful experience there. Staffs are really cooperating and manager Sharad there is really cooperative since i had less cash and had paytm balance so he asked me to pay him via paytm and he paid the cash on my behalf..
So people please do visit treebo sakchi jamshedpur once

Treebo crystal studio is a nice place to stay. Situated in Sakchi, at the third floor, the hotel has good rooms, nicely maintained and spacious. The front office is courteous and helpful. Overall good value for money. The service is good. They do not have inhouse restaurant, but several restaurants around and hotel will help you to get food. Staff is polite and courteous.

The hotel rooms are spacious and very clean which I liked the most. They do not have an in-house restaurant but the restaurant on the ground floor serves the purpose. I did not like the approach to the hotel. To sum it up, it is value for money hotel for short stay's.

Rooms are spacious and Clean. Staff is very friendly and service was top notch. Location is good if you are looking for a place near Tata Steel. It doesn?t get better than this under 2K in Jamshedpur.

This hotel and hotel staff is very good .
And hotel is very neat and clean. I am very impressed and i want to stay next time in hotel treebo hangout regidency. We diside in future we stay only in hotel treebo.

Room service ia pathetic..Staffs were too lazy when it comes to provide service on time.Rooms are not good at all. Complementary breakfast is just next to horrible.My first visit to Jamshedpur will be remebered because of this hotel

Me and my wife stayed here for 1 night. The room and the toilet were very clean, linen and towels were also sparkling clean. Restaurant food was refreshing and delicious. Room service was good. I will definitely come back to this hotel and recommend it to all.

Visited KC Manor Treebo for one night. Location is very good. 10 mins from the station and a string of shops on both sides. Initially the room allotted had some smell but they immediately changed the room. We had an early morning checkout so they packed breakfast as it was included in the room. For rate they offered very good stay.

Stayed for 5 nights with my parents. Was a very pleasant stay overall. The room service and response is excellent with very little delay in attending to any requests. The dining and breakfast area is also quite pleasant and breakfast is a worth opt-in since there is nothing much nearby. They have a good enough spread with slight variation every morning. The a-la carte dinner was wonderful too. We had 2 meals and were not disappointed at all. The taste and service were both good.

The only issue we faced was that the drain in the bathroom was not working well. The water kept getting retained on the floor which was super annoying and quite disgusting. Despite making multiple requests, there was no solution to this problem which is totally unacceptable. Please check this aspect before you opt for a room.

The stay was very comfortable and staffs were also courteous. The rooms very also very nice and spacious the bathroom was fantastic and the connectivity to all places was also good. The overall experience was amazing

Should stay here if in Jamshedpur.
Value worth for the amount paid.Book only online that too in treebo.com.

Other websites and on the spot payment would be expensive

The breakfast is very monotonous and definitely needs some variety and freshness. Each room should be provided newspapers early morning. The food menu for rooms also needs some more variety specially in the punjabi section.

Wi-fi service was during my 4 nights stay & as per Treebo Gaurantee we should get a refund of 300/ day.

I informed front desk regarding no Wi-fi.

I was staying in Room no. 205 then in 405. but in both the room there was wi-fi. I complained many times but didn't get the wi-fi/internet throughout my complete stay. service quality ha to be improved.

I stayed at KC Manor Jamshedpur on 7.12.2017. In november I stayed at the same hotel in room No 106. That room was good. This time they offered Room No 107 a room not up to the standard in comparison to room number 106. Asked several times for menu card for ordering food got after long waiting. In washroom the shower didn't lock when switched over to hot water section. So no hot water through shower. Last time I liked the hotel but next time definitely not to be checked in this hotel

Treebo is good hotel chain all view I am satisfied staff is good Manor halpfull oval all its value for money next time definitely must be try....food quality is good some improvement in breakfast and variety pls improve all done

Overall experience was OK. Area is good, public transport communication is very good. Services are Ok, staffs are good they help really. Food services are good but a bit costly with respect to the quality of food.

This is a nice budget hotel in Jamshedpur. Located in Bistupur area . Superb connectivity from that place to roam around the city. It was renovated recently and rooms are spacious and neat and clean. Excellent Wi-Fi facility is available also.

I mostly prefer staying at this hotel during my trips to the city. Location wise it's very approachable and provides a comfortable stay with good food. Only negative point I found is that they don't have all English channel's subscription for their TV.

God Bless you guys and i will surely reccomend my family and friends to come here always. The support staff good too no doubt. All the best.

We had an excellent stay in Ginger, we arrived at the train station, and were pleased to know the hotel was only a few shorts blocks away. Nice, helpful and friendly staff, good restaurant, good morning buffet. Would again return for a stay at this hotel. Special thanks to prabanjan at front desk.

We went for the founders day (Tata) and stayed at this hotel.
its very clean and well maintained. staff is amazingly efficient right from the check in
mr prabanjan was helpful.
in house restaurant is good for lunch/dinner . their breakfast isnt all that good very oily food. no booze (carry your own and have in the room)

We were on a road trip and stopped here for an overnight stay. It was pretty late when we checked in. Thankfully, they had a room available. It was very neat and clean and the air conditioner worked just fine. The washroom was clean and well stocked with soaps and shampoos. we didn't need anything more for our short stay.

It is an average hotel on the outskirts of jamshedpur city. The staff here are very nice people. The rooms are kinda cheap, but the amenities in the room are not completely upto date. I mean, it's clean and all, but the place had n old fashioned tv and our washroom's geyser seemed old.

Overall, its a nice place to stay if you are travelling on a budget.

We had a adventure course on the outskirts of Jamshedpur and we had a day to kill and we friends decided to spend the night here. The rooms were properly maintained and good enough for a budget stay. A little away from the city but it is peaceful at the night. Recommended

A beautiful place to spend two nights . Homely atmosphere, spic n span rooms and toilets which we all require during travel to anywhere. Toileteries in the room simply awesome in the price tag. People are courteous . Only five cottages but that is my point oif view is absolutely O.K.More people , off course more business but more noise too. The authority is very choosy about the occupants and they do not allow generally young people or young couple . That is good or bad is different issue but acceptable to me. As this place is in the amidst of nature so to maintain the serenity is important. One point I did inform to the host that breakfast with sandwich is not that good in terms of quantity . They told me that whether I did ask for more or not. Yes none of us did ask for sure but at the same time it could have been asked from the part of the owner. As a result , on the departure date we wanted to know that Puri /Sabji can be had if requires . They politely said 'Yes".If not then we were ready to pay more for extra. This is not a complaint but little professionalism could have been more enjoyable. At last , a great stay

This place is well situated away from the city, surrounded by natural beauty from all sides. Lush greenery is maintained inside the resort. The resort boasts of a small pond, where fishing can be done, but on prior request, but on a catch and release basis.
They also carry out farming of vegetables in their garden space. Apart from the cozy cottages, there are many spots to just laze about and enjoy nature. 
The food served by the staff is very delicious. Must try is the 'desi chicken'. The host and staff are very friendly, but have a set of norms for their visitors, which is very appreciable. This place is only meant for families, as maintained by the host. 
Also, for a bird-watcher like me, one would find plenty of winged species flying in and around the resort

We went to The Weekend Resort last weekend and in one word the stay at this resort was awesome.The resort is exceptionally well maintained.There are 5 AC cottages and the rooms are also very well maintained with LED TV in the room (though we didn't turn it on :) ) and geyser in the bathroom.They provide wide range of toiletries.

In this resort they do organic farming and if you walk around the resort you'll get to see plenty of vegetables, fruits and flowers.Whatever food (except fish/chicken) we ordered it was picked from the garden and then cooked.The taste of the food was awesome.

If you have kids along with you, they will enjoy the place like anything.

This is such a peaceful place that it will surely rejuvenate your mind.There are few places which you can go explore from here. 3 kilometers away there is a place called Paharbhanga which can be explored in early morning.Its better to avoid this place after 10 am as it gets hot.One can also go to Dimna lake and Jubilee park in Tatanagar which is around 22-25 kms.The hotel people advised us not to go to Dimna lake after sunset and we abided by it.They were very helpful and showed great hospitality.

If you are a drinker you need to carry your booze.You will not find anything outside this resort.You can also order Mahua and their staff will bring it for you.

I would also like to do a special mention of their staff "Gobindo" who was very nice.This guy does his work happily and will always ensure that you are comfortable and enjoying every bit of your stay in this resort without any trouble.

The only negative thing that i found was that few food items (like Duck,Mutton) were a bit expensive.

The deluxe rooms were very good - clean and spacious with attached balcony. Room service was very efficient. 
Breakfast was complimentary and served in the restaurant- The Woods. Normally, there was bread, eggs, puri sabji, cornflakes, idli/alu paratha, juices, tea/coffee available for breakfast. 
The resort had a nice lawn which was decorated during the Holi day. Our team had a good time playing with colors. There was also a small children park to keep the kids busy. Special lunch thali @499 was served on the Holi afternoon in the lawn. The taste of the items was good but the quantity was very little. In the evening, we had starters specially the Pahari chicken which was too good. Food was tasty but expensive. The service was good though, we were served ice creams even though we ordered them pretty late at night.

Overall a well-maintained resort, to enjoy a couple of days in the lap of nature.

Every year special food festivals are held at the Chopsticks Restaurant of Hotel Boulevard, and this year was no different. While most major restaurants in Jamshedpur hold Bengali Food Festivals duirng the Bengali New Year period, the popularity of such festivals depend not just on the publicised long list of menu items, but more importantly on the authenticity of Bengali flavours. 

On this last and most important criterion I found Chopsticks to score heavily over its other peers. For a true Bengali food connosieur a sure shot "put-off" is to discover a Punjabi flavour in the much touted "Dhokar Dalna" or Echorer Dalna" - a mandatory listing on any Bengali speciality menu. Unfortunately, many of the restaurants take the easy shortcut to use their base Punjabi gravy to garnish these so called Bengali dishes and make a mess of their pretensions of offering authentic Bengali fare.

While the vegetarian menu during the Bengali Food festival at Chopsticks was not only authentic but also as near as possible to grandma"s standards of tasty Bengali cooking. Even the Begun Bhaja and Chholaar daal were of the lip smacking variety. 

Not to be left behind, the fish dishes were a real revelation as far as the sizes of the fishes were concerned, backed uop with real fine cooking. It was clear that that "Paabda" fish was specailly brought from the premier Kolkata markets, instead of compromising with the smaller specimens available locally. The Hilsa dish was also well prepared, but to be honest, the out of season Hilsa really could not contribute much to the overall tastiness of the dish. The mutton in the "Kosha Mangso" was indeed tender and provided just the contrasting blend to supplement the fish dishes.

Due thoughtfulness was shown in the dessert items too, and special mention needs to be made of the mango chutney - an absolute must for a summer menu, and the "payesh" to round off a truly satisfying "Bangali Bhoj"

Last but not the least, a comparison of the rates charged makes the Chopstick fare a hugely superior value for money, added with the convenience of being offered a choice between a la carte; buffet and "thaali" options

A short stopover for lunch at Chopsticks was a pleasant surprise for the sheer VFM.

All in all - a nice option for a hearty chinese meal.

Located diagonally opposite to the Hyundai showroom on the Sakchi road, Pod & Beyond is a small pod concept hotel in Jamshedpur.
This was my first trip to the city and travelling on a budget, this was my choice after going through a lot of hotels (and their reviews) online. I stayed for three nights in the Queen Pod which is a single occupancy room with an en-suite bathroom. The check in and check out was super smooth. Here goes the review ?

Room ? The room is smaller than regular hotel rooms but since it?s a pod themed hotel, so I guess it was justified. Everything was very clean and looked and smelled nice. There?s a split AC which I didn?t need all through my stay. The lighting in the room is alright. Two comfy pillows with spotless linen over a queen size bed with a standard ten-inch mattress, ensured great sleep quality. Ample number of power sockets and light switches within reachable distance (without getting up from the bed), was very thoughtful. There is a reading light too on the bed side. There?s an LCD TV on the wooden partition facing the bed with Airtel DTH connection which played most of the channels I liked. Right below it, is a small yet very convenient table for keeping your day to day things (wallet, glasses etc).
The area on the other side of the partition is like a small dressing room cum study. It has a small table with a chair and an ottoman. Along with that, a mini fridge and a dresser and a spacious wooden wardrobe with some cloth hangers. A bottle of water and emergency light is kept on the table. However, I never experienced a power cut during my stay. There's free Wi-fi too and the coverage and speed were pretty good.

Bathroom - Right after this, we have the bathroom. It?s a decent sized bathroom and I found it perfectly clean and hygienic. There?s a well-functioning geyser too and the bath fittings are shiny new. The amenities included a pair of slippers, a hand wash liquid soap and big bottles of shampoo and body wash from good brands.
Service ? The service was nothing short of pleasant. Right from the front desk to the people serving breakfasts and dinners, everyone was very friendly and always had a smile. It?s a budget hotel and so the staff is limited, but I never found any delay in any of the services (mostly food). All meals are served in a small cute dining area which has an attached kitchen. Makes you feel like you are eating at home. Even the taste of the food is so homely. Simple yet delicious. Every morning I used to get a wake-up knock on the door by the ever so friendly Mr. Rakesh, asking me what I?d like to have for breakfast. In the evenings, Miss Rajni would give me a call on my phone asking me if I?d like to have dinner at the hotel and what would be my food choices. And by the time I got back to my room, the dinner was always ready ? piping hot and yummy.

All these little things add up to make this sweet little hotel a great place to stay. It's well under the budget and has all the amenities of a good hotel. There's no fancy food which in my opinion and for a change, was a good thing. The food is simple and comforting. And just to add a bit more about it, nothing in their small but good enough menu is overpriced. If you are travelling to the city and looking for a great budget hotel, stay here. The Queen Pod is the best of the rooms they offer. Others are mostly small yet comfortable pods which are bunk beds with a little privacy and all the amenities.
It's simple, minimalistic and homely. I'd stay here again on my next trip.

When it came to the decision of picking a venue for important functions during my marriage, and for hosting my guests travelling from different locations, "The Sonnet" was an easy first choice. 

The team from the Sonnet, led by their manager, Mr. Anup Kumar Bera, did a fantastic job of taking ownership for the entire event.
